Introduction to Real Analysis, Volume I (Jiri Lebl, 2025) -- Chapter 07 -- Section 06

Definition 7.6.1. A map between metric spaces is a contraction if it is Unknown identifier `k`k-Lipschitz for some Unknown identifier `k`sorry < 1 : Propk < 1, i.e., there exists Unknown identifier `k`sorry < 1 : Propk < 1 such that dist sorry sorry sorry * dist sorry sorry : Propdist (Unknown identifier `` p) (Unknown identifier `` q) Unknown identifier `k`k * dist Unknown identifier `p`p Unknown identifier `q`q for all . For a self-map , a point Unknown identifier `x`x is a fixed point when Unknown identifier ``sorry = sorry : Prop x = Unknown identifier `x`x.

def contraction ( : X Y) : Prop := k : NNReal, (k : ) < 1 LipschitzWith k
def fixedPoint ( : X X) (x : X) : Prop := x = xomit [PseudoMetricSpace X]

The book's fixed point notion coincides with Function.IsFixedPt.{u} { : Type u} (f : ) (x : ) : PropFunction.IsFixedPt.

theorem fixedPoint_iff_isFixedPt ( : X X) (x : X) : fixedPoint (X := X) x Function.IsFixedPt x := by rfl
end

Theorem 7.6.2 (contraction mapping principle or Banach fixed point theorem). If (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d`d) is a nonempty complete metric space and is a contraction, then Unknown identifier `` has a unique fixed point.

theorem contraction_unique_fixedPoint (X : Type u) [MetricSpace X] [CompleteSpace X] [Nonempty X] ( : X X) (h : contraction (X := X) (Y := X) ) : ! x : X, fixedPoint (X := X) x := by classical rcases h with k, hk_lt, hk_lip have hk : ContractingWith k := by exact_mod_cast hk_lt, hk_lip refine ContractingWith.fixedPoint (f := ) hk, ?_, ?_ have hx : Function.IsFixedPt (ContractingWith.fixedPoint (f := ) hk) := ContractingWith.fixedPoint_isFixedPt (f := ) hk exact (fixedPoint_iff_isFixedPt ( := ) _).2 hx intro y hy have hy' : Function.IsFixedPt y := (fixedPoint_iff_isFixedPt ( := ) y).1 hy have hunique := ContractingWith.fixedPoint_unique (f := ) hk hy' simpa using hunique

Theorem 7.6.3 (Picard's theorem on existence and uniqueness). Let Unknown identifier `I`sorry = [sorry, sorry] : PropI = [Unknown identifier `a`a, Unknown identifier `b`b] and Unknown identifier `J`sorry = [sorry, sorry] : PropJ = [Unknown identifier `c`c, Unknown identifier `d`d] be closed bounded intervals in : Type with failed to synthesize Membership ?m.1 (?m.4 ?m.5) Hint: Additional diagnostic information may be available using the `set_option diagnostics true` command.Unknown identifier `x`x (Unknown identifier `a`a, Unknown identifier `b`b) and failed to synthesize Membership ?m.1 (?m.4 ?m.5) Hint: Additional diagnostic information may be available using the `set_option diagnostics true` command.Unknown identifier `y`y (Unknown identifier `c`c, Unknown identifier `d`d). Suppose is continuous on Unknown identifier `I`sorry sorry : Type (max u_1 u_2)I Unknown identifier `J`J and Lipschitz in the second variable with Lipschitz constant Unknown identifier `L`L, meaning |sorry - sorry| sorry * |sorry - sorry| : Prop|Unknown identifier `F`F x y - Unknown identifier `F`F x z| Unknown identifier `L`L * |Unknown identifier `y`y - Unknown identifier `z`z| for all Unknown identifier `x`sorry sorry : Propx Unknown identifier `I`I and . Then there exists Unknown identifier `h`sorry > 0 : Proph > 0 with [sorry - sorry, sorry + sorry] sorry : Prop[Unknown identifier `x`x - Unknown identifier `h`h, Unknown identifier `x`x + Unknown identifier `h`h] Unknown identifier `I`I and a unique differentiable function with values in Unknown identifier `J`J such that Unknown identifier `f`sorry = sorry : Propf x = Unknown identifier `y`y and Unknown identifier `f'`sorry = sorry : Propf' x = Unknown identifier `F`F x (f x) on [sorry - sorry, sorry + sorry] : List ?m.15[Unknown identifier `x`x - Unknown identifier `h`h, Unknown identifier `x`x + Unknown identifier `h`h].

theorem metric_picard_existence_uniqueness {a b c d x y L : } (hI : a b) (hJ : c d) (hx : x Set.Ioo a b) (hy : y Set.Ioo c d) (F : ) (hF_cont : ContinuousOn (fun p : => F p.1 p.2) (Set.Icc a b Set.Icc c d)) (hL_nonneg : 0 L) (hF_lip : x Set.Icc a b, y Set.Icc c d, z Set.Icc c d, |F x y - F x z| L * |y - z|) : h > 0, Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h) Set.Icc a b f : , DifferentiableOn f (Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h)) ( x Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h), f x Set.Icc c d) f x = y ( x Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h), HasDerivAt f (F x (f x)) x) g : , DifferentiableOn g (Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h)) ( x Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h), g x Set.Icc c d) g x = y ( x Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h), HasDerivAt g (F x (g x)) x) Set.EqOn g f (Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h)) := by classical have _ : a b := hI have _ : c d := hJ -- Compactness of the rectangle gives a uniform bound on `F`. have hcompact : IsCompact (Set.Icc a b Set.Icc c d) := (isCompact_Icc).prod isCompact_Icc have hnonempty : (Set.Icc a b Set.Icc c d).Nonempty := by refine x, y, ?_ exact Set.Ioo_subset_Icc_self hx, Set.Ioo_subset_Icc_self hy obtain p, hp, hpmax := hcompact.exists_isMaxOn hnonempty (hF_cont.norm) have hM_max : q Set.Icc a b Set.Icc c d, F q.1 q.2 F p.1 p.2 := by simpa [isMaxOn_iff] using hpmax set M : := F p.1 p.2 with hM_def have hM_nonneg : 0 M := norm_nonneg _ have hF_bound : x Set.Icc a b, y Set.Icc c d, F x y M := by intro x hx y hy have hmax := hM_max x, y hx, hy simpa [hM_def] using hmax -- Margins in the `x`- and `y`-directions. set x : := min (x - a) (b - x) with hx have hx_pos : 0 < x := by have hx_left : 0 < x - a := sub_pos.mpr hx.1 have hx_right : 0 < b - x := sub_pos.mpr hx.2 have := lt_min hx_left hx_right simpa [hx] using this set y : := min (y - c) (d - y) with hy have hy_pos : 0 < y := by have hy_left : 0 < y - c := sub_pos.mpr hy.1 have hy_right : 0 < d - y := sub_pos.mpr hy.2 have := lt_min hy_left hy_right simpa [hy] using this -- A convenient positive bound for the integrals and the Picard interval. set B : := M + 1 with hB have hB_pos : 0 < B := by linarith set hbig : := min x (y / B) with hbig_def have hbig_pos : 0 < hbig := by have hpos1 : 0 < y / B := by exact div_pos hy_pos hB_pos have := lt_min hx_pos hpos1 simpa [hbig_def] using this -- Work on the smaller symmetric interval to avoid endpoint issues. set h : := hbig / 2 with h_def have hh_pos : 0 < h := by nlinarith have h_le_hbig : h hbig := by nlinarith have hbig_le_ax : hbig x := by simp [hbig_def] have hbig_le_left : hbig x - a := by have hx_le_left : x x - a := by simp [hx] exact le_trans hbig_le_ax hx_le_left have hbig_le_right : hbig b - x := by have hx_le_right : x b - x := by simp [hx] exact le_trans hbig_le_ax hx_le_right have hsubset_big : Set.Icc (x - hbig) (x + hbig) Set.Icc a b := by refine Set.Icc_subset_Icc ?_ ?_ linarith [hbig_le_left] linarith [hbig_le_right] have hsubset : Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h) Set.Icc a b := by refine Set.Icc_subset_Icc ?_ ?_ linarith [hbig_le_left, h_le_hbig] linarith [hbig_le_right, h_le_hbig] -- Realize the data for the PicardLindelf theorem. let aBall : NNReal := y, le_of_lt hy_pos let Lnorm : NNReal := B, le_of_lt hB_pos let K : NNReal := L, hL_nonneg have hclosedBall_subset : Metric.closedBall y y Set.Icc c d := by have hy_le_left : y y - hbig) (x + hbig) := by constructor <;> linarith let t : Set.Icc (x - hbig) (x + hbig) := x, ht0_big have hIPL : IsPicardLindelof (fun t y => F t y) t y aBall 0 Lnorm K := by refine { lipschitzOnWith := ?_ continuousOn := ?_ norm_le := ?_ mul_max_le := ?_ } intro t ht refine LipschitzOnWith.of_dist_le_mul ?_ intro y hy z hz have hyJ : y Set.Icc c d := hclosedBall_subset hy have hzJ : z Set.Icc c d := hclosedBall_subset hz have htI : t Set.Icc a b := hsubset_big ht have h := hF_lip t htI y hyJ z hzJ simpa [Real.dist_eq, K] using h intro x hx have hxJ : x Set.Icc c d := hclosedBall_subset hx have hmap : Set.MapsTo (fun t : => (t, x)) (Set.Icc (x - hbig) (x + hbig)) (Set.Icc a b Set.Icc c d) := by intro t ht exact hsubset_big ht, hxJ have hcont : Continuous fun t : => (t, x) := continuous_id.prodMk continuous_const exact hF_cont.comp hcont.continuousOn hmap intro t ht x hx have htI : t Set.Icc a b := hsubset_big ht have hxJ : x Set.Icc c d := hclosedBall_subset hx have hM' : F t x M := hF_bound t htI x hxJ have hMB : F t x B := by linarith simpa [Lnorm] using hMB have hle : hbig y / B := by simp [hbig_def] have hmax : max ((x + hbig) - (t : )) ((t : ) - (x - hbig)) (aBall : ) := by simpa [Lnorm, aBall, hmax] using hprod simpa using hprod' -- Construct the Picard fixed point on the big interval. have hx_init : y Metric.closedBall y ((0 : )) := by simp obtain sol, hsol := ODE.FunSpace.exists_isFixedPt_next hIPL hx_init let f : := sol.compProj have hf_cont : Continuous f := by simpa [f] using sol.continuous_compProj have hf0 : f x = y := by have hx0_mem : x Set.Icc (x - hbig) (x + hbig) := ht0_big have hx0_comp : f x = sol x, hx0_mem := by simpa [f] using (ODE.FunSpace.compProj_of_mem ( := sol) (t := x) hx0_mem) have hinit : sol t = y := by have h := congrArg (fun => t) (show ODE.FunSpace.next hIPL hx_init sol = sol from hsol) simpa [ODE.FunSpace.next_apply] using h.symm simpa [t] using (hx0_comp.trans hinit) have hsmall_sub_big : Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h) Set.Icc (x - hbig) (x + hbig) := by intro x hx constructor <;> linarith [h_le_hbig, hx.1, hx.2] have hf_range_big : t Set.Icc (x - hbig) (x + hbig), f t Set.Icc c d := by intro t ht have ht' : f t Metric.closedBall y y := by simpa [f] using (sol.compProj_mem_closedBall hIPL.mul_max_le (t := t)) exact hclosedBall_subset ht' have hf_range : t Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h), f t Set.Icc c d := by intro t ht exact hf_range_big t (hsmall_sub_big ht) have hf_derivWithin : t Set.Icc (x - hbig) (x + hbig), HasDerivWithinAt f (F t (f t)) (Set.Icc (x - hbig) (x + hbig)) t := by intro t ht simpa [f] using (by apply ODE.hasDerivWithinAt_picard_Icc t.2 hIPL.continuousOn_uncurry sol.continuous_compProj.continuousOn (fun _ ht' sol.compProj_mem_closedBall hIPL.mul_max_le) y ht |>.congr_of_mem _ ht intro t' ht' nth_rw 1 [ hsol] rw [ODE.FunSpace.compProj_of_mem ht', ODE.FunSpace.next_apply]) have h_lt_hbig : h < hbig := by nlinarith [hbig_pos, h_def] have hx_big_interior : x Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h), x Set.Ioo (x - hbig) (x + hbig) := by intro x hx constructor <;> linarith [hx.1, hx.2, h_lt_hbig] have hf_deriv : x Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h), HasDerivAt f (F x (f x)) x := by intro x hx have hx_big : x Set.Icc (x - hbig) (x + hbig) := hsmall_sub_big hx have hwithin := hf_derivWithin x hx_big have hx_int := hx_big_interior x hx exact hwithin.hasDerivAt (Icc_mem_nhds hx_int.1 hx_int.2) have hf_diff : DifferentiableOn f (Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h)) := by intro x hx exact (hf_deriv x hx).differentiableAt.differentiableWithinAt have hf_contOn : ContinuousOn f (Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h)) := hf_cont.continuousOn -- Package the result with uniqueness on the smaller interval. refine h, hh_pos, hsubset, ?_ refine f, hf_diff, hf_range, hf0, hf_deriv, ?_ intro g hg_diff hg_range hg0 hg_deriv have hg_cont : ContinuousOn g (Set.Icc (x - h) (x + h)) := hg_diff.continuousOn have ht0_small : x Set.Ioo (x - h) (x + h) := by constructor <;> linarith [hh_pos] have hv : t Set.Ioo (x - h) (x + h), LipschitzOnWith K (fun y => F t y) (Set.Icc c d) := by intro t ht refine LipschitzOnWith.of_dist_le_mul ?_ intro y hy z hz have htI : t Set.Icc a b := hsubset (Set.Ioo_subset_Icc_self ht) have hdist := hF_lip t htI y hy z hz simpa [Real.dist_eq, K] using hdist have hf_deriv_Ioo : t Set.Ioo (x - h) (x + h)) := by simpa using (ODE_solution_unique_of_mem_Icc (v := fun t y => F t y) (s := fun _ => Set.Icc c d) (K := K) (hv := hv) (ht := ht0_small) (hf := hf_contOn) (hf' := hf_deriv_Ioo) (hfs := hf_range_Ioo) (hg := hg_cont) (hg' := hg_deriv_Ioo) (hgs := hg_range_Ioo) (heq := by simp [hf0, hg0])) exact hEqOn_fg.symm
